subject: Re: [junit] Dave's weird code indentation
msgSnippet: Maybe just odd numbers. I d find 9 weird, too. So said Kevin Klinemeier on 3/11/2003 -------------------- What about seven?!  I think its discrimination
messageBody:
Maybe just odd numbers. I'd find 9 weird, too.

So said Kevin Klinemeier on 3/11/2003 --------------------
What about seven?! I think its discrimination against the prime
numbers above three.

-Kevin
--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
> What's with indenting 5 spaces?! :)
>
> I've seen 2, 3, 4, 6 and 8, but never 5.
>
> So said Dave Astels on 3/11/2003 --------------------
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
> wrote:
> (I replaced indentation
> spaces with periods as yahoo seems not to handle leading spaces well
> in my experience):
>
> final int [] randomValues = {3, 5, 1, 2, 4, 0 };
> Random fakeRandom = new Random() {
> .....int index = 0;
> .....public int nextInt(int n) {
> .........int result = randomValues[index];
> .........index = (index + 1) % randomValues.length;
> .........return result;
> .....}
> };
> aGame.orderPlayers(fakeRandom);
